intro: Aiouea benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' aiouea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the coastal regions of New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom during the spring and summer seasons. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The bark is smooth and greyish, often exuding a resinous sap that is a distinguishing feature of the species.
